reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great closet organizer, easy assembly
reviews.reviewText: I've come to love these units in various configurations. I have the three drawer nightstand I have the four drawer TV stand and now I have the five drawer lowboy which is in my closet, and now my closet looks great. Easy for one person to assemble, sturdy, affordable and aesthetically pleasing. I got an amazing deal buying "used." It's literally new, just the box was banged up a bit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Small but fits perfectly
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this for my 3yr old granddaughters small bedroom. Drawers are deep. It's sturdy too. We set her TV on too if it. Super easy to put together. Shipping was fast

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Little Dresser for the Money
reviews.reviewText: I was needing a little dresser to hold clothes that I normally fold. I was using the plastic tubs style drawers, but wanted something a little nicer to place in the bedroom, but something cheap. This is when I found this. It was cheap and appeared to be nice looking, at least nice for the money. This is what I think of it:Pros:- Ease of assembly: This was very easy to assemble. There were a couple issues, but I'll address those in the cons. But as far as difficulty, this was one of the easier things I've assembled.- Looks: This little dresser looks pretty good when you think about paying under $90 for it. You can tell it is not expensive, but it still looks nice.- Packaging: It was packaged well, but what impressed me the most was the individually packaged hardware and parts being labeled. Usually with cheaper things like this, you get hardware not labeled and have to guess what is what. These all were labeled clearly.- Size: This is perfect for smaller areas like dorms or small apartments. It is not very deep, but I was able to fit more than I expected, especially in the larger drawers.- Weight: This is very light. When it was fully assembled, I was able to easily pick it up and put it in place. This also means that it can also move easily when you don't want it to, but this can be fixed by placing a little rug tape under the feet if this is one a hard surface.Cons:- Included tool: The included tool is a 90 degree allen wrench with a phillips screwdriver on the long side. The allen wrench worked alright, but the phillips screw driver was terrible. I ended up using one of my own. This was one of the things that made the assembly less than perfect.- Fitment: The middle supports on mine were a bit difficult to install. I had to use a little force to bend the long supports outward to get the screws to start. This was the case with all 3 of them. Once I got the screws started, I was able to tighten them down easily, but getting them started was a bit of a chore.- Alignment: I had one drawer support that was welded a little higher than the other. This cased the drawer to sit a little higher on one side. This is pretty noticable, but not a deal breaker for me.Overall, I'm happy with this purchase. It is small enough to fit in a limited space, cost was just about right, and it was easy to assemble. If you are looking for something cheap and easy to put together, and you do not have a lot of clothes you're looking to put in it, this is definitely something to consider. Just don't expect perfection or compare it to higher priced furniture or you will be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I really like this! It was easy to assemble and it looks really nice. It is a little shorter than I thought it would be (my fault, the measurements are on the listing) but even still it works well in the space I put it in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for my preteen daughter
reviews.reviewText: My daughter hangs most of her things in the closet and she was wanting more room for her vanity and sketch desk so we ditched the big wooden dresser for this cute, sturdy dresser. We actually put it in her closet under her clothes and it fit perfect and still has room underneath it to put all her shoes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The screws for the handles to draws are WAY too short. It was near impossible getting all the handles on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy-ish to assemble, seems sturdy
reviews.reviewText: It seems pretty sturdy for what it is. The drawers are that flimsy non woven fabric stuff, but they include little thin Masonite panels to put in the bottoms. It was easy enough for me to assemble by myself, just a bit awkward at times, but no missing pieces or misaligned holes, no chips or dings. They only had dark gray, and since it’s going into the black hole under a craft table, I spray painted the drawer fronts with a light colored spray paint I had lying around, and it actually looks pretty good. I feel like it will hold a lot of stuff, and I like the higher ground clearance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Would have been five stars…
reviews.reviewText: Would have been five stars if it wasn’t for multiple missing pieces. This is a cheap thing so don’t expect much, the “wood” parts are obviously really cheap that will be ruined if they get damp and the metal parts are very thin but all of that is to be expected in this day and age but because of missing pieces I’d give this product zero stars because it’s not even missing screws or something that you can easily go to the store and buy more for pennies nope I’m missing a few different metal pieces that prevent you from actually building this. I went to their website that it directs you to for support and their chat option just says they’re offline and to message them your phone number so that they can contact you, how about no? Why would I give you my personal information because you don’t want to provide proper support. I’ve emailed them and I will update this review if they ever respond to me and if they even send me the missing pieces but that could take months seeing as it will take a few weeks if I’m lucky for them to respond to my email and then another month or so for them to ship the item to me since you know they will ship it as cheaply as possible so it’s going to take a long time and probably won’t even arrive.And yes I did look all throughout the box and under everything so no the parts aren’t just hidden.
